"The consequences of forcing a major power, especially a nuclear power, into a corner are even more unimaginable," Yucheng added.

349.title: Target is 2024 LS polls, needs more hard work: Mulayam to SP cadre
349.article_body: SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has addressed the party workers by saying that the next "target is 2024" general elections and will require "more hard work and strengthening of the party". Speaking at a Holi gathering in Saifai, Yadav praised the workers for their effort which helped SP in getting its highest vote share ever in the UP Assembly elections.

350.title: Karnataka govt provides 'Y' category security to HC judges who gave hijab verdict
350.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said that 'Y' category security will be provided to three judges of Karnataka High Court, including Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who recently upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. This comes after a video of a person threatening to kill Justice Awasthi surfaced online. Three persons have been booked in this connection.

351.title: Around 100 injured as makeshift gallery collapses at football ground in Kerala
351.article_body: Around 100 people are said to be injured after a makeshift gallery collapsed at a football ground in Kerala. The gallery was made of bamboo and areca nut tree slats and collapsed after it couldn't withstand pressure with hundreds of people sitting on it to watch a football match. Several of the injured had broken legs and arms. reports said.

352.title: Rahul gave me bowling, he's my favourite captain: Shreyas Iyer
352.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised KL Rahul's captaincy, stating that the 29-year-old has a "very calm demeanour" and his on-field decision making is very "instinctive". Iyer added, "I really enjoyed playing under him. Also, he gave me three overs of bowling [during South Africa ODIs], which none of the captains previously had done. So yeah, he's my favourite captain."

353.title: Baseless allegations made due to Raj polls next yr: Vaibhav Gehlot
353.article_body: President of the Rajasthan Cricket Association Vaibhav Gehlot has dismissed the allegations levelled at him of duping a Nashik resident. "Rajasthan Assembly polls (are) scheduled to be held next year. So, these kinds of baseless allegations will be levelled at me," said Gehlot. The FIR was lodged against 16 people, including Gehlot, at the Gangapur Police Station in Nashik.

354.title: US man wrongfully jailed for 23 years seeks $93 million in lawsuit
354.article_body: A 45-year-old man from US' Kansas has filed a lawsuit seeking $93 million (over ₹706 crore) in damages after he was wrongfully convicted for double murder. Lamonte McIntyre and his mother claimed that a detective coerced her into sex and then framed him for murder after she rejected the detective's sexual advances later. McIntyre had served 23 years in jail.

355.title: Multiple explosions at Pakistan military base spark massive fire, video surfaces
355.article_body: A massive explosion occurred in the northern Pakistani city of Sialkot on Sunday, ANI reported. Rishi Suri, editor of The Daily Milap, said that multiple explosions took place at the Sialkot military base in northern Pakistan. He said in a tweet, "Initial indications are this is an ammunition storage area. A large fire is burning. Cause as yet unverified."

356.title: Unfortunate that Congress didn't call it a genocide: Anupam on 'The Kashmir...'
356.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', reacted to the Congress' remark wherein they said that the Kashmiri Hindus cannot be classified as "internally displaced persons". He said, "It is unfortunate that the ruling government of that time did not think of protecting or of not calling it a genocide." "It is a genocide...It's not fiction," he added.

357.title: Bhagavad Gita in textbooks will improve kids' intelligence level: Bommai
357.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that if Bhagavad Gita is incorporated in textbooks, it will improve the intelligence level among children. "What is wrong with it? The education department is also making preparations to introduce it in our state. Let them give their report first. We will then decide in this regard," he added.

358.title: SC issues notice on daughters’ plea to trace 89-year-old mother
358.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice on a petition filed by two daughters seeking their mother’s whereabouts, a resident of Bihar’s Muzaffarpur. The 89-year-old woman was brought to Delhi’s Ganga Ram hospital for treatment in February, 2022 but remained untraced after February 26 when she was moved to an undisclosed location by her son.

359.title: Elizabeth Hurley shares old pics with Warne from their engagement celebration in SL
359.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley took to Instagram to share old pictures with Warne from their engagement celebration in Sri Lanka. "My heart aches...I can't be in Australia for Shane's [private] funeral," she wrote. She added, "It seems too cruel that all...people who loved him will never have another Lion hug, but our memories will live forever."

360.title: Vir Das praises Ukrainian comedians for organising show in bomb shelter
360.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a report saying that comedians in Ukraine's Sumy held a stand-up show in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion. The Kyiv Independent, a Ukraine media outlet, shared that three comedians performed for about 100 people in one of the bomb shelters in Sumy. Vir shared the report and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

361.title: H'wood action choreographer Yannick Ben joins Samantha's 'Yashoda'
361.article_body: Hollywood action choreographer Yannick Ben has been roped in for Samantha Ruth Prabhu's action-thriller 'Yashoda'. Yannick has previously worked in films like 'Transporter 3', 'Inception' and 'Dunkirk'. He has also worked in Indian projects, including 'The Family Man', Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Raees' and Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. 'Yashoda' will release in multiple languages.

362.title: Eng beat NZ by 1 wicket to register their 2nd win in Women's WC 2022
362.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by one wicket to register their second win in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup 2022. Chasing New Zealand's 203-run total England's Natalie Sciver scored 61 off 108 balls as her side managed to save a wicket and won the match in 47.2 overs. This is New Zealand's fourth defeat in six games in the tournament.

363.title: Woman dies as police constable allegedly shoots her in Punjab, probe on
363.article_body: A woman died after a police constable allegedly shot her in Punjab's Haibowal area. Police rushed to spot and found a dead woman with a bullet injury. "Investigations are going on...prima facie is yet to be confirmed....the accused, who shot the woman, was constable...He has been hospitalised due to a bullet wound by the neighbours," Police said.

364.title: Depression over southeast Bay of Bengal, Andaman Sea to intensify in 24 hrs
364.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Saturday's low-pressure system intensified into a depression over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining south Andaman Sea on Sunday. The depression will further intensify into a deep depression in the next 24 hours, the IMD added. The IMD had earlier predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21.

365.title: Russian cosmonauts deny flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag
365.article_body: Russian cosmonaut Oleg Artemyev denied their flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag. He said, "There is no need to look for any hidden symbols." He added that the three cosmonauts who arrived at International Space Station wearing yellow suits with blue accents were graduates of Bauman Moscow State Technical University and had picked the colours of their alma mater.

366.title: China on right side of history: Chinese Minister on Ukraine crisis
366.article_body: Chinese Foreign Affairs Minister Wang Yi told reporters on Saturday that "time will prove" that the country's claims are on the "right side of history" over the Russia-Ukraine conflict. He added that the country stands for maintaining peace and its position is "in line with the wishes of most countries". Earlier, China had said that Russia has "legitimate security concerns".

367.title: Remo D'Souza pays off the loan for a contestant on sets of DID L'il Masters 5
367.article_body: Choreographer Remo D'Souza paid off the loan of an eight-year-old contestant named Himanshu on the DID Li'l Masters 5. Himanshu's mother revealed she is being harassed because she's a female rickshaw puller, and has also landed in a debt to buy the rickshaw. Hearing this, Remo said, "Please let me know the amount that's pending, I will pay it off."

368.title: Kyiv mocks Russia after shooting down their jet, shares meme
368.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv mocked Russia after shooting down Russia's Su-34. It wrote, "Another Russian Su-34 was shot down near Kyiv. It makes it, what, 94th?" It added, "Wondering what will happen first... the 100th plane or 300 rubles for $1? Tell us what you think!" The Russia-Ukraine war entered its 25th day today.

369.title: 2 dead, 23 rescued as wall of old building undergoing renovation collapses in Guj
369.article_body: Two persons died and 23 others were rescued after the wall of an old commercial building, where renovation work was underway, collapsed in Gujarat's Surat. The wall of the building's second floor collapsed when drilling activity was in progress and injured the two youths, who were standing on the ground. They were declared dead on arrival at a hospital.

370.title: I feel no. 3 is my position, but I'm ready to explore: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer
370.article_body: KKR's newly-appointed captain Shreyas Iyer has said he's ready to bat at any position in the upcoming IPL season. "On a given day, I can be a power-hitter and there can be some other player who can play anchor role...I feel number three is my position [but]...wherever team wants me to bat at...I'm ready to explore," he added.

371.title: 4 pose as ACB officers, extort ₹10 lakh from BDA officers in B'luru
371.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly posing as Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officers and extorting ₹10 lakh from Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) engineers. The accused reportedly extorted the money under the pretext of removing the engineers' names from ACB's case files. The incident came to light after one of the engineers filed a complaint in the matter.

372.title: 2 dead, 14 injured as dumper rams into 2 vehicles in Haryana's Nuh
372.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, died and 14 persons were injured after a dumper carrying stones allegedly rammed into a tractor thresher and a bus in Haryana's Nuh on Saturday. Locals and relatives of the victims alleged police officials were chasing the dumper to check for illegal mining and they fired a gunshot flattening the dumper's tyre, leading to collision.

373.title: Russia has failed to gain control of air: UK on Ukraine resistance
373.article_body: The UK Ministry of Defence has said the Ukrainian Air Force is continuing to effectively defend Ukrainian airspace. It added, "Russia has failed to gain control of the air and is largely relying on stand-off weapons launched from the relative safety of Russian airspace." It also said that gaining control of the air was one of Russia's principal objectives.

374.title: 20 including kids injured, 1 killed in shooting at car show in US
374.article_body: One person was killed and 20 others, including children, were injured in a shooting outside a car show in Dumas in US' Arkansas on Saturday, police said. One person has been taken into custody, but there may've been multiple shooters, the town's Police Chief Keith Finch said. "For something like this to happen, it's a tragedy," the event's organiser said.

375.title: 24-year-old man attacks worshippers in Canada mosque with bear spray
375.article_body: A 24-year-old man entered a mosque in Canada's Toronto and attacked people with bear spray on Saturday, said police. The worshippers at Dar Al-Tawheed Islamic Centre tackled the man, identified as Mohammad Moiz Oma, who was reportedly brandishing a hatchet. "They tackled him to the ground and apprehended him until the police showed up," said a Muslim body official.

376.title: Pope meets refugee Ukrainian children undergoing treatment in Rome
376.article_body: Pope Francis on Saturday met Ukrainian children who escaped war and are currently undergoing treatment at a paediatric hospital in Rome. He was seen talking to a girl with a bandaged head in a picture. As many as 19 children are receiving treatment for cancer, neurological conditions or war injuries caused by explosions, said the Vatican.

377.title: Was invited alone on 1st date, took all friends: Isha Koppikar on husband
377.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar said that her husband Timmy Narang had invited her to his house for their first date. "He had invited only me alone...but I took all my friends along! I recall telling him, 'If you want me to come and meet you, they will accompany me'. There were 15 of us...we landed up at his place," Isha added.

378.title: Kashmiri Pandits will get relief when they return home in valley: Bukhari
378.article_body: Apni Party chief Altaf Bukhari said that Kashmiri Pandits will only get relief when they return to their homes in valley. While talking about 'The Kashmir Files', he said, "If rehabilitation takes place by making movie...I would have liked 50 more movies...I'm not saying do not make movies...what when such movies are made to help someone get votes?" he added.

379.title: Virat told me on the bus 'You might've to captain': Rahul recalls SA tour
379.article_body: Recalling the South Africa tour, where he captained India in the Johannesburg Test, KL Rahul said, "Like everyone else, [captaincy] came to me as a huge surprise." Rahul added, "The morning of the game, Virat (Kohli) came to me...said, 'My back is not feeling great, you might've to captain'...it's an honour not many people get....I was very happy."

380.title: 5 teenagers drown while swimming in river after playing Holi in Gujarat
380.article_body: Five teenagers drowned when they went for a swim in a local river after playing Holi in Gujarat's Devbhumi Dwarka district. Police said after home guard jawans posted there prevented the boys from jumping in the river, they entered the river from the opposite bank. "Apparently, they were not aware that the water was deep that side," an inspector said.

381.title: It was extremely difficult to wear eye lens in 'Bachchhan Paandey': Akshay
381.article_body: Akshay Kumar, when asked what was the most difficult part of shooting for 'Bachchhan Paandey', said wearing the eye lens for his character was "extremely difficult". "It was a very big lens. I would see everything blurry and that's how I used to shoot. I would just see that there is a figure in front of me," Akshay added.

382.title: Kashmir Files to be dubbed in Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam & Kannada
382.article_body: The makers of 'The Kashmir Files' have decided to dub the film in four languages. It'll be dubbed in Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam and Kannada. Written and directed by Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, the film has collected ₹141.25 crore in India so far. 'The Kashmir Files', starring Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty and Pallavi Joshi, was released in theatres on March 11.

383.title: 2 persons die after drowning in water-filled ditch in UP's Bahraich
383.article_body: Two persons drowned after their motorcycle fell into a ditch filled with water in UP's Bahraich, police said on Friday. They had come to Bahraich to celebrate Holi and were returning home when the incident occurred. The duo was in an inebriated state and performing stunts on the motorcycle when they lost control and fell into the ditch, police said.

384.title: IPL created the market: Uthappa to Pakistani journalist glorifying PSL over IPL
384.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa responded to a Pakistani journalist who tried to glorify PSL over IPL. "One has to admit PSL gained worldwide popularity more quicker in an era when other boards had introduced their leagues too whereas there was no competitor in the market when IPL was born," the journalist had written. Uthappa responded, "IPL created the market!"

385.title: Hilarious: Ashneer reacts to YouTuber Ashish's 'sasta' Shark Tank acting
385.article_body: Shark Tank India's judge, BharatPe co-founder Ashneer Grover reacted to a video of the show's spoof by YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani. Taking to Instagram, Ashish shared a teaser of the show, where the entrepreneurs are seen pitching their ideas and the 'sharks' reacting to them. He captioned the post, "Entries...open for Sasta Shaark Tank." Reacting to the post, Ashneer wrote, "Hilarious!"

386.title: Mumbai Coastal Road project to be completed by Nov 2023: BMC
386.article_body: The Mumbai Coastal Road project will be completed as per the decided deadline of November 2023, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said on Saturday. Once the construction of the 10.58 km long road is complete, another 8.5 km long and 20-metre wide sea promenade between the Priyadarshini Park and the Worli side of the sea link will be added.

387.title: It will take you several generations to recover: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to Russia
387.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said in a video address, "I want everyone to hear me now, especially in Moscow. The time has come for a meeting, it's time to talk." He added, "The time has come to restore territorial integrity and justice for Ukraine. Otherwise, Russia's losses will be such, it will take you several generations to recover."

388.title: 1 killed, 53 hurt as 2 communities clash over rash driving in MP
388.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and about 53 others injured after Muslim and tribal communities clashed in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen, police said. Some locals had reportedly reproached a bike rider for driving rashly, following which he returned with a few others and beat them, a police official said. Later, tribals gheraoed shops belonging to Muslims, another police official said.

389.title: Director said 'Just copy what I do', reduced level of actor to monkey: Tisca
389.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said that a director once told her to "just copy" what he did. "He basically reduced the level of a trained actor to that of being a monkey. I don't see him working actively right now, but at that time, I was young, and it was hard to deal with that sort of condescension," she added.

390.title: Sweeper locks Chandigarh hospital's private ward, naps inside; suspended
390.article_body: A sweeper was suspended after he was found napping inside a private ward of a hospital in Chandigarh. Reports said that the door of the private ward was locked from inside and the sweeper opened it after some knocking. "The sweeper has been suspended and the outsourced agency has been asked to substitute him," UT Health Secretary Yashpal Garg said.

391.title: I was like who do I call when I've panic attack: Shawn post-breakup with Camila
391.article_body: Speaking about his breakup with his ex-girlfriend, Camila Cabello, singer Shawn Mendes said, "You don't realize when you're breaking up with someone [and] all the s*** that comes after it. Which is like, who do I call when I'm...in a panic attack." Shawn further said that he's on his own now. "I hate that...[but] that's my reality," he said.

392.title: Pastor killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur: Police
392.article_body: Maoists allegedly killed a pastor on suspicion of being a police informer, in Bastar’s Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, police said on Saturday. The police stated that a Maoist pamphlet was recovered from the spot. The deceased was dragged out of his house and attacked with sharp-edged weapons by the Maoists, Inspector General of Police, Bastar range, Sundarraj P, said.

393.title: JNU scholars move Delhi HC as admin changes their PhD supervisor
393.article_body: Two JNU research scholars moved Delhi High Court after the administration issued an order to change their PhD supervisor midstream. The University said that the decision was taken as the guide would superannuate in less than three years. The petitioners, fourth-year MPhil-PhD students, argued that adding a new person as supervisor could hamper their ability to complete research.

394.title: Ferrari's Leclerc beats Red Bull's Verstappen, gets pole at Bahrain GP
394.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc beat Red Bull's Max Verstappen to claim pole position in the first qualifying session of the 2022 Formula One season at the Bahrain Grand Prix. Leclerc finished with a time of 1:30:558. Leclerc's teammate at Ferrari Carlos Sainz finished in third place while Verstappen's teammate at Red Bull Sergio Perez finished in fourth place.

395.title: Bengal BJP MP claims bomb hurled at his car after watching 'The Kashmir Files'
395.article_body: Jagannath Sarkar, BJP MP from West Bengal's Ranaghat, has alleged that a bomb was hurled at his car while he was returning after watching the film 'The Kashmir Files'. "We escaped the bomb narrowly. No one is secure in Bengal...Democracy has been toppled by the state government," he said. Sarkar added that President's rule should be imposed in the state.

396.title: 2 groups clash after objection over playing DJ music near mosque in UP
396.article_body: Six people were arrested after members of two communities pelted stones at each other after getting into argument over playing of DJ music during Holi in Amroha district. Police said group was playing DJ music in empty plot next to mosque in Kotwali area, following which a group of people objected to music being played. The argument soon turned violent.

397.title: Heavy vehicles barred from entering Faridabad during day till April 4
397.article_body: Heavy vehicles will be barred from entering Faridabad during the day from March 19 to April 4 to avoid congestion during Surajkund International Crafts Mela. "Thousands of commuters travel to attend the Surajkund mela due to which there is heavy congestion...Heavy vehicles can only enter Faridabad between midnight and 7 am till April 4," said an official.

398.title: 3 parking employees held for extortion in Chandigarh's Sector-26 grain market
398.article_body: The Chandigarh Police, while acting on the directions of the Punjab and Haryana HC, arrested a parking manager and his two staffers for charging entry fees at the Sector 26 grain market. The HC bench had directed police to register a criminal case against the market's parking contractor if his staff is found charging a parking fee.

399.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister shares pic of ruins of theatre bombed by Russia
399.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to share a picture of ruins of the drama theatre in Mariupol bombed by Russia. "Inhuman Russian war crime. I want to ask multinational companies still working with or in Russia: how can you keep doing business with them? How can you feed, serve, and pay those who did this?" he wrote.

400.title: Ghaziabad aims to vaccinate 1.44 lakh in 12-15 age group in 15 days
400.article_body: After being given a target by the state health department to vaccinate 1,44,000 children in the 12-15 age group, Ghaziabad district health department officials said that they aim to achieve the target within a fortnight. According to Additional Chief Medical Officer Dr Sunil Tyagi, 15 centres in the district have a "given supply of Corbevax vaccines".

401.title: ASI killed, 10 injured after mob sets Bihar police station on fire
401.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) was killed and 10 others were injured after a mob allegedly set fire to a police station over a custodial death in Bihar's Bettiah on Saturday. The police fired 15 rounds and resorted to lathi-charge to stop the mob. Earlier, a man who was reportedly playing orchestra during Holi celebrations had died in police custody.

402.title: Video of death threat against K'taka HC Chief Justice surfaces after hijab judgement
402.article_body: Police have registered a case and booked three persons in Tamil Nadu over a video of a person threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi and others. It comes days after the judgement of the court upholding the ban on hijab in educational institutions. The three accused are functionaries of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath (TNTJ).

403.title: My husband gets very affected: Sunny on trolls attacking their parenting
403.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said her husband Daniel Webber gets very affected when anything is said about their children, especially Nisha, who they adopted and when trolls attack their parenting. "I don't read [such comments on social media]. Daniel, on the other hand, reads everything...It hurts his feelings," Sunny added. "He's extremely sensitive about children, especially Nisha," she said.

404.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 2,000, active cases at 26,240
404.article_body: India has reported 1,761 new COVID-19 cases and 127 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 127 deaths, 21 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 106 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,479, and the active cases declined to 26,240.
